meanings.definition: (rare, archaic) to be angry; to rage.
meanings.english_definition: (rare, archaic) to be angry; to rage.

examples.sentence: The king did iare at the messenger.

etymology.value: Origin uncertain, possibly related to Old English 'ierre' (angry).

usage_notes.explanation: This word is extremely rare and archaic. It is unlikely to be encountered in modern English.

readability_explanation.text: This word is highly uncommon and considered archaic. It is not part of the standard English vocabulary. Encountering it is highly unlikely. Understanding is only relevant for historical or literary contexts.
